name: scicite
instruction: In this task, you are given a citation intents based on citation context in the computer science and biomedical domains. Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

instances.input: CONTEXT: , 2007; Dirks, 1998; Haw et al., 2001; Pinto et al., 2000; Soderberg, 2001). This wide difference could be explained by different timing of personality assessment, different methodologies of personality assessment, and different definitions of DSH in each study. For example, in majority of studies except the study by Haw et al. (2001), personality assessments were carried out within days to a fortnight following the index DSH when the subjects were still suffering from acute mood disturbance. The prevalence of BPD might have been over-inflated due to the state on trait bias in these studies. On the other hand, some studies employed self report measures (Haw et al., 2001) and informant-based structured interview (Dirks, 1998) for diagnosis of BPD and that might have led to systematically different results from those using clinician-administered structured interviews including SCID-II. In addition, the different definitions of DSH might also influence the prevalence of PDs. While a majority of the studies used the WHO definition of parasuicide which does not specify lethal intent, Berk et al. (2007) used the definition by O‚ÄôCarroll et al. (1996) which requires the presence of lethal intent.

Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

instruction: In this task, you are given a citation intents based on citation context in the computer science and biomedical domains. Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

instruction: In this task, you are given a citation intents based on citation context in the computer science and biomedical domains. Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

instruction: In this task, you are given a citation intents based on citation context in the computer science and biomedical domains. Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

instances.input: CONTEXT: In addition, although Parkin KO mice do not recapitulate signs central to Parkinsonism, these mice are prone to cancer development (Fujiwara et al., 2008). Moreover, Parkin heterozygous deletion accompanied by APC heterozygous deletion promotes intestinal adenoma development in mice. As HCC appears in the mice at advanced age, and there is a dependency between Parkin and APC mutations in adenoma development, it is possible that a mutation in Parkin alone is not sufficient to initiate development of some types of cancer, and it may require additional risk factors. Moreover, we identified Parkin interacting proteins in melanoma cells by immunoprecipitation followed by mass spectrometry. Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

instruction: In this task, you are given a citation intents based on citation context in the computer science and biomedical domains. Your job is to classify into one of three classes from ("background", "method", and "result"). The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.

The "background" class indicates the citation states, mentions, or points to the background information giving more context about a problem, concept, approach, topic, or importance of the problem in the field. The "method" class indicates the making use of a method, tool, approach or dataset. The "result" class indicates the comparison of the paper's results/findings with the results/findings of other work.
